channel.title: Nothing important just a question

item.title: Nothing important just a question
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You should research state systems. Although I don’t really condone providing any sort of server help, in terms of a game which works over a chat system (such as a command on a private server or an IRC message), you need to have some sort of state machine which remembers the progress of a game for each player playing. Each command will test the state machine to see if its compatible with that stage, then update it and provide the user with information. You also need to remember to cleanup after yourself, as these types of games can easily be designed to never cleanup unfinished or finished games, etcetera.

Read full topic

item.title: Nothing important just a question
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Been scimming through some tutorials that I thought would help me and I got an idea for a jackpot minigame from JavaProgrammer

Thought I could mess around a bit in notepad++ to see what I could do and I failed
Don’t laugh at my failness but I need help making a JackPot minigame that he wanted from this topic
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,515046.msg3739424.html#msg3739424

I did this… I wasn’t finished at all but I wanna see if I was going anywhere
If you want me to finish (might take a while) than tell me

[code=java]package org.dementhium.content.minigames;

import org.dementhium.content.activity.ActivityManager;
import org.dementhium.model.Item;
import org.dementhium.model.npc.NPC;
import org.dementhium.model.Location;
import org.dementhium.model.World;
import org.dementhium.model.player.Player;
import org.dementhium.net.ActionSender;
import org.dementhium.net.PacketHandler;
import org.dementhium.net.message.Message;

public class JackPot {

public static void main(String[] args) {

public boolean startJackPot
	return guess;

public int guess;
	this.guess;

int usedGuess {
usedGuess = 3;

switch (usedGuess) {
	case 1:
	player.sendMessage("You have 2 guesses left.");
	if (player.getRights() >= 2) {
	player.sendMessage("Admins cannot play the minigame.");

}
break;
case 2:
player.sendMessage(“You have 1 guess left.”);
if (player.getRights() >= 2) {
player.sendMessage(“Admins cannot play the minigame.”);
}
break;
case 3:
player.sendMessage(“You have used all of your guesses.”);
if (player.getRights() >= 2) {
player.sendMessage(“Admins cannot play the minigame.”);
}
break;
default:
player.sendMessage(“You cannot guess anymore”);
if (player.getRights() >= 2) {
player.sendMessage(“Admins cannot play the minigame.”);
}
}
}
}
}[/code]

I guess he thought I was good at some java

Tell me if I was going anywhere
